data.title: Breakfast in Allen Texas
data.text: Good food and good service.  Not fancy but a comfortable place for a weekend breakfast with the family.  Staff is very friendly and the prices are reasonable for consistently good food.  Favorite place for pancakes.

data.title: Bad breakfast
data.text: Came here for breakfast because locals recommended it and I was disappointed. Took over 5 minutes just for a chocolate milk and my meal had hashbrowns so I asked for some melted cheese to be mixed with the hashbrowns. They gave me a slice of barely melted cheese on top. Aesthetically it was horrible and tasted even worse. The eggs were so slimy I barely ate anything. Worst breakfast.

data.title: Good place but not great
data.text:
Pretty well packed on a Sunday for lunch. Waiting area full but I don't see the big deal as food was good to average.

i ordered Gyros Omelette and there was NOTHING Greek about it and tiny bits of Gyros were almost invisible. Wife ordered pancakes w/eggs and they were OK.
First visit and not worth a return in my opnion - Denny's & IHOP better choices.
Staff was friendly but overwhelmed and service suffered.

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text:
I got a blueberry pancake and one breakfast burrito. 

The pancake had lots of blueberries. It was more chewy than Cakey. 

Tasty and I ate all of it. About eight inches in diameter. 

The burrito was egg and potatoes and cheese. The potatoes were hash browns that were shredded.  Different but not bad 

Tasty. Needed a little salt. 

Good hearty breakfast for locals. This was definitely local crowd no tourists. Inexpensive.

data.title: Average breakfast
data.text:
We'd attempted to visit here three times, each time giving up as the lines were so long.  We thought it must be good then.  We finally got in and were a bit disappointed.  The service was fine, the restaurant needs a little clean up or refreshing.  I read in another review that this place has not got the best health grades, the latest rating was 80, substantially lower than other restaurants. 
The coffee was not hot, but rather medium warm - got cold very quick.  The toasted sandwiches were very greasy as was the hash browns.  I came out of there feeling like I'd had too much oil.

data.title: Really great local cafe
data.text:
We visited this cafe after church service on a Sunday.  Very friendly staff, great coffee.  We had biscuits and gravy and French toast.  I definitely want to come back.  

They serve breakfast and lunch.

data.title: Good typical Cafe food.
data.text:
Good variety, great skillet breakfasts, and friendly staff.  The best part of every visit over the years has been the friendly staff...always friendly.  My favorite was the Megaburger, the largest burger with a chopped steak patty.  Im waiting a while before revisiting as the last three times the meat was so over-cooked regardless of request on the front end of ordering.  Maybe they will get another cook who knows what medium or med-rare is...
Overall, I would revisit and probaly will...

data.title: Great little place!
data.text: Really great alternative to the large eateries in the Plazas. Had breakfast here. Service was excellent and food was excellent.

data.title: Best Breakfast Ever!!!!!!
data.text:
This place is small but their dishes are big, delicious and affordable.  If you like to eat breakfast, this is the place to go. We eat there every morning before returning to West Texas.  I usually have the eggs over easy, ham, hash browns, side of biscuits and gravy and coffee.  This is a meal.  My wife likes their pancakes, sausage, and bacon.
Not sure if they serve lunch because I love their breakfast.

data.title: Great cafe, fantastic service
data.text: We stopped in for lunch one day. I was delighted they had beef stroganoff. The food was above average for a cafe. The service was terrific, very courteous and friendly. We'll definitely stop back in again.

data.title: BEST BREAKFAST IN ALLEN
data.text: I eat breakfast here a lot and am always pleased with what I get.  Friendly service and comfortable surroundings.

data.title: Quintessential local flavor!
data.text: This is the kind of place you want to go to eat with and see the locals. A bit off the beaten path, Allen Cafe is worth the diversion. Their waffles are simply the best and the ethnic staff is delightful. Try ordering Gyro as your breakfast meat! Love, love, love Gyro omelets.

data.title: Local Hangout
data.text: This place was so classy, and so delicious!  All the locals in Allen seemed to be there and the food was on point!  Service was exteremly friendly and attended to my every need.  Great place to eat anytime of the day!

data.title: Great Down-Home Cooking!
data.text: I can remember when the Allen Cafe was the old Dairy Queen and my kids used to get free sundaes after baseball and soccer games (long ago).  Years ago it was converted to a cafe. The down-home cooking is delightful.  We went on a Sunday morning after early church and it was packed.  After a short wait, we were served a delicious breakfast.  I noticed that the girl who was seating people, also, cleaned off the menus.  A nice touch for the health concious!

data.title: Great breakfast  destination
data.text: The Allen Cafe is a small local cafe which has limited hours.  Breakfast and lunch specials make this a good bargain.  Food is good with large portions.  Restaurant closes daily at 2 PM.

data.title: Always great for breakfast
data.text: We go to Allen Cafe for breakfast regularly. It is usually busy but worth the wait. It is simple, home cooking and the service is unbeatable. I just wish they were closer to my home!

data.title: Great local breakfast spot.
data.text: kept driving by to go to the post office, and the parking lot always had a lot of cars, my first clue.  Finally, stopped for breakfast, yummy homemade food thought Mom was in the kitchen.

data.title: Good food, but low health score
data.text: We won't be back.  The breakfast here is good, but I just saw online that the City of Allen gave this place a relatively low grade for cleanliness, etc. The staff isn't very friendly (although service is satisfactory) and I hear many speaking some foreign language or speaking English with heavy accents. That in itself is not problem, but we don't like taking a chance eating someplace that doesn't get good health grades.

data.title: Allen Cafe
data.text: Had breakfast there a few days ago and was disappointed with the quality of the food. Ordered omelette with hashbrowns and biscuits. The hashbrowns tasted very greasy. The omelette was warm in temperature as well as coffee. I do not plan to go back to eat there.

data.title: Good start to the day
data.text:
Nice family run restaurant offering good freshly cooked food.  Friendly and efficient staff and endless fill ups of coffee. 
I enjoyed the corn beef hash so much on my first visit, I chose it again for my second visit.  Well flavoured beef and nice hash brown.
